User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 Firefox/3.6.15
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 Lightning/1.0b2 Thunderbird/3.1.9

It would be very interesting to have the possibility to group emails within a folder using the Panorama approach from Firefox 4.

I would like to select a few emails related to a given topic and group them using the drag and drop approach of Panorama. New emails could be later on added to a topic, and emails in a given topic could be further on remove from the topics (as tabs may be added and removed from groups in Panorama).

Additionally, the way Panorama displays groups of tabs could be used to display various topics in a given folder, providing an overview of the content of the folder and giving an easier access to a set of emails related with a given topic.

Finally, I really thing that such a way to display emails is a real improvement in that it focuses on topics that the user defines, instead of displaying a threaded view or a conversation mode based on "reply" actions.

I really thing that implementing this feature would place Thunderbird ahead the competition (cf. Gmail).

Reproducible: Always
comments.author: picard@kti.ue.poznan.pl

comments.text:
I would like to comment on the recent change from component "Folder and Message Lists" to "Toolbars and Tabs" made by ludovic.

While Panorama is used in Firefox to sort and group tabs, I would like to suggest similar functionality in Thunderbird but not for the tabs. I would like to suggest a new view for the emails in a given folder.

Instead of a list or a tree as usually displayed in the message list, it would be nice to have the possibility to group *messages* in a similar way as Panorama may be used to group tabs in Firefox.

Here Panorama is suggested as a means to display, group and filter messages.

If this is what you want we already have that :

1) tag your messages
2) create virtual saved search folders and you are done

comments.raw_text:
The solution with tags does not provide the following features that would be in the suggested approach based on Panorama:

- it is not possible to have an overview of the topics in a given folder when the search folders are separated (instead of a set of groups on the same panel in the Panorama approach)

- is is not possible to "scale" a set of messages according to the user's preferences, leading to a graphical representation of the importance of a given topic in a given folder. With Panorama, important tabs may be scaled up to be more visible, while less important tabs may be scaled down.

- With Panorama, grouping, sorting, filtering are performed on a drag'n drop way, with visual feedback. Tags are not that visual.

- With Panorama, groups are located on a given place on the screen. Similarly, the suggested approach for messages groups would allow the user to locate on the screen given groups of messages (for instance, messages from my boss should be in the group on the left-top of the screen)

- tags and its support in Thunderbird are not as nice graphically as Panorama is;)

A main advantage of tags over Panorama is the possibility to "store" a message in many virtual folders at the same time.

To better understand the enhancement I am proposing, I would suggest to look at the video presenting Panorama at http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5r0TQJ-gGi0 and imagine that Panorama is used with emails instead of web pages.
